abstract: North County Correctional Facility in Castaic, Los Angeles County, ends policy of chaining inmates to wall until their bodies expel contraband; inmates sometimes were chained for as long as 11 hours so that officers could recover contraband swallowed or concealed in body cavities.
lead_paragraph: A Los Angeles County jail has ended a policy of chaining inmates to a wall, sometimes for as long as 11 hours, until their bodies expel contraband.

headline.main: California: Jail Ends Chaining for Contraband
headline.print_headline: California: Jail Ends Chaining for Contraband

snippet: A Los Angeles County jail has ended a policy of chaining inmates to a wall, sometimes for as long as 11 hours, until their bodies expel contraband.
